#Load the required libraries 



```{r}

library(readxl)

library(dplyr)

library(tidyverse)

library(forcats)

library(ggthemes)

library(plotly)

library(knitr)

library(naniar)

library(ggplot2)

library(maps)

library(ggmap)

library(maptools)

library(sf)

library(ggmosaic)

library(here)

library(gridExtra)
```



#Load the processed data from the RDS



```{r}

CDV19_clean <-   readRDS(here("data", "processed_data", "CDV19_clean.rds"))



glimpse(CDV19_clean)

vis_miss(CDV19_clean)
```
```{r}



#The data we are most interested in is the Species data over time and the area data over time so we'll begin by exploring these

Species_freq19 <- ggplot(CDV19_clean, aes(Species, fill=Species, color=Species)) +geom_bar()  +
theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 8), legend.position = "none") +labs(y="Number of Cases")

Species_freq19
ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new", "Species_freq19.png"), plot = Species_freq19)

Speciestable19<- as.data.frame(with(CDV19_clean, table(Species))) 
colnames(Speciestable19)[2] <- "n"

Speciestable19 %>% saveRDS(here("results", "Tables","Speciestable19.rds"))
#we can see that Raccoon and Gray fox are hugely over represented compared to the others so we should focus our analysis on these two species
```
```{r}
library(RColorBrewer)
#are there any obvious differneces in species by state?
Species_by_state19 <- ggplot(CDV19_clean, aes(Species, fill=Species, color=Species)) +
geom_bar()   + 
theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 8), legend.position = "none") +facet_wrap( ~ State)

Species_by_state19 
ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new","Species_by_state19.png"), plot = Species_by_state19 )
```
```{r}
raccoongrayfox19 <- subset(CDV19_clean, Species %in% c("Raccoon", "Gray Fox"))
RGF19 <- with(raccoongrayfox19, table(Species, CollectionYear))
RacFox19<- ggplot(as.data.frame(RGF19), aes(CollectionYear, Freq, fill = Species, color = Species, group = Species))  + 
  geom_point() +geom_line() + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 6)) +labs(x="Collection Year, 1975-2019", y= "No. of Cases")

RacFox19
ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new", "RacFox_year19.png"), plot = RacFox19)


#looking overtime there appears to be some patterns in the number of postive cases, with definite peaks possibly relating to epizootics of CDV
#It also looks like there may be a delay in the Gray Fox peak following the peak in Raccoons, this is worth looking into
#Would be good to run a time series analysis on this data to see if peaks in raccoon cases are predicitive of grayfox peaks
```

```{r}
#From here lets just focus on Georgia, Foxes, Raccoons,

RacFox_Age19
ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new", "RacFox_Age19.png"),plot = RacFox_Age19)
#there may be something here, worth looking at statistically going forward


```
```{r}

tb19
```

```{r}
#bivariate mosaic plot of Sex and species
SexSpecies_Mosaic19 <- ggplot(RGFSex19) +geom_mosaic(aes(x=product(Sex, Species), fill=Sex)) +labs(x= "Species", y="Sex")

SexSpecies_Mosaic19

ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new","SexSpecies_Mosaic19.png"),plot = SexSpecies_Mosaic19)


sexspec19<- with(RGFSex19, table(Sex, Species))


chisex19<- chisq.test(sexspec19)
chisex19

```

```{r}
#Bivariate of Age and Species
agemos19 <- ggplot(RGFAge19) +geom_mosaic(aes(x=product(Age, Species), fill=Age)) + labs(x= "Species", y="Age")
#The age measurement is too subjective to read much into really, also depends on reproductive strategy and life history of species... are there more offspring? are they hidden?
agemos19
ggsave(here("results", "Figures_new", "RGFAge_mosaic.png"), plot = agemos19)


agespec19<- with(RGFAge19, table(Age, Species))


chiage19<- chisq.test(agespec19)
chiage19

#in this case the chisquared is greater than the critical value (5.99), but age is so subjective in this case it would need to be much higher 
```
```{r}
library(tidycomm)
na.omit(RGFSex) %>% crosstab(Species, Sex, Age, percentages  = TRUE)

```
```{r}
#chi squared test for sex and species
library(corrplot)
na.omit(RGFSex) %>% crosstab(Species, Sex, chi_square =  TRUE)

sexchi<- na.omit(with(RGFSex, table(Sex, Species)))

chisex <- chisq.test(sexchi)
chisex$observed

round(chisex$expected,2)

chisex$residuals

corrplot(chisex$residuals, is.corr = F)

contribsex <- 100*chisex$residuals^2/chisex$statistic
round(contribsex, 3)

corrplot(contribsex, is.cor = FALSE)
```
```{r}
na.omit(RGFSex) %>% crosstab(Species, Age, chi_square =  TRUE)

```

```{r}
#continued exploration, using month data


#Join the data by cases number
CDVGA <- subset(CDV_Clean, State %in% "Georgia" & Species %in% c("Raccoon", "Gray Fox"))
CDVGA2 <- CDVGA %>% mutate(County = recode(County, "Chattoogna" = "Chattooga", "Dekalb" = "DeKalb")) %>% mutate(CaseNumber = as.numeric(as.character(CaseNumber)))


CDVmonths <-    readRDS(here("data","processed_data","CDVmonths.rds"))


CDVGA_months <- left_join(CDVGA2, CDVmonths, by = "CaseNumber" )
CDVGA_months<- CDVGA_months [-c(8:14)]

colnames(CDVGA_months)[2]<- "State"
colnames(CDVGA_months)[3]<- "County"
colnames(CDVGA_months)[4]<- "Species"
colnames(CDVGA_months)[6]<- "Sex"
colnames(CDVGA_months)[7]<- "Age"



CDVGA_months <- CDVGA_months %>% mutate(Month = as.integer(as.character(Month)))
RFD<- ggplot(CDVGA_months, aes(Month, fill=Species)) + geom_bar()

RFD
ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "RGF_per_month.png"), plot = RFD)

Speciesmonth_Mosaic <- ggplot(CDVGA_months) +geom_mosaic(aes(x=product(Species, Month), fill=Species))

Speciesmonth_Mosaic
ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "RGFmonth_mosaic.png"), plot =Speciesmonth_Mosaic)
```

```{r}
ffrt <- CDVGA_months[c(4,6,8)] %>% dplyr :: filter(Sex %in% c("Male", "Female")) %>% 
  group_by(Species, Sex, Month) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(n = n()) %>%
  dplyr::ungroup() %>% spread(Sex,n) %>%
  mutate(Male = ifelse(is.na(Male), 0, Male)) %>%  
  mutate(Female = ifelse(is.na(Female), 0, Female)) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(Proportion_Female= (Female/(Female+Male)))

prop_female<- ggplot(ffrt, aes(Month, Proportion_Female, fill = Species, color = Species, group = Species))  + 
  geom_point() +geom_line() + geom_point() 

prop_female

ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "Prop_female_per_month.png"), plot = prop_female)
```

```{r}
#If we quickly plot a histogram using latitude it suggest there are some geographic differences in distribution 
CDVGA2 <- readRDS(here("data", "processed_data", "CDVGA2.rds"))
GAC<- readRDS(here("data", "processed_data", "Georgia_County_Map_Data.rds"))   
LAT <- left_join(GAC, CDVGA2, by= "County") %>% subset( Species %in% c("Raccoon", "Gray Fox"))

lat_hist<-ggplot(LAT, aes(lat)) + geom_histogram()  +
 facet_wrap(~Species)

ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "Latitude_RGF_hist.png"), plot = lat_hist)

#This is interesting, there are two disticnt latitudinal peaks for raccoons but only 1 for gray foxes
```

```{r}
Centro<- readRDS(here("data", "processed_data", "GACentroiddata.rds"))
Centro <- Centro %>% mutate(CaseNumber = as.numeric(as.character(CaseNumber)))

CentroMonth<-left_join(CDVGA_months,Centro)
glimpse(CentroMonth)

cennew<- CentroMonth %>% dplyr:: mutate(NS= lat)  %>% dplyr::mutate(NS= 

                      ifelse(NS < "32.67328", "South",

                      ifelse(NS >= "32.67328", "North", "no")))

```

```{r}
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 6)) 
NSP


```

```{r}

RFNSfreq <- as.data.frame(with(cennew, table(NS, Species))) %>% spread(key = NS, value = Freq) %>% dplyr::mutate(Total = (North + South)) %>% mutate_at(vars(North, South), funs(./Total))


RFNSfreq2 <- as.data.frame(with(cennew, table(NS, Species))) %>% spread(key = Species, value = Freq) 
colnames(RFNSfreq2)[2] <- "Gray_Fox"
RFNSfreq3<- RFNSfreq2 %>% dplyr::mutate(Total = (Gray_Fox + Raccoon)) %>% mutate_at(vars(Gray_Fox, Raccoon), funs(./Total))

tt<- with(cennew, table(NS, Species))

NS_Mosaic <- ggplot(cennew) +geom_mosaic(aes(x=product(NS, Species), fill=NS),  na.rm = TRUE) +labs(x= "Species", y="North/South")

NS_Mosaic

ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "NS_Mosaic.png"), plot=NS_Mosaic)

chisp <- chisq.test(tt)
chisp

#this value of chisq is above the critical value so we can reject the null hypothesis that species and northern and southern latitudes are independent. ie. Gray fox cases are more likely in the northern part of the state

chisp$observed

round(chisp$expected,2)

chisp$residuals

corrplot(chisp$residuals, is.corr = F)

contrib <- 100*chisp$residuals^2/chisp$statistic
round(contrib, 3)

corrplot(contrib, is.cor = FALSE)
```

```{r}
#split into breeding season
#split months into breeding and non-breding- feb-july, or split further into mating, lactating and non-breeding? m,j,j -> lactating in GF, feb, march, april -> mating and prenancy, rest of year as non-breeding


glimpse(CentroMonth)

censea<- as.data.frame(CentroMonth) %>% dplyr:: mutate(Season= Month)  %>% mutate(Season = as.character(as.integer(Season))) %>% dplyr::mutate(Season= recode(Season, "2"="Breeding", "3"= "Breeding", "4"="Breeding", "5"= "Lactation", "6"="Lactation", "7"="Lactation", "8"= "Non-Breeding", "9"= "Non-Breeding","10" ="Non-Breeding", "11"= "Non-Breeding", "12" = "Non-Breeding", "1"= "Non-Breeding" ))


breeding <- as.data.frame(with(censea, table(Season, Species)))
#adjust for length of seasons
breedingadj1 <- breeding %>% dplyr :: mutate(lengthSea= c(3,3,6,3,3,6))
 breedingadj2 <- breedingadj1 %>% dplyr:: mutate(SeaAdj = (Freq/lengthSea))

breedingplot<- ggplot(breedingadj2, aes(Season, SeaAdj, fill = Species, color = Species, group = Species)) + geom_point() +geom_line() + labs(y="Cases per season/season length")

breedingplot

ggsave(here("results", "Figures", "breeding_plot.png"), plot=breedingplot)
```
